Lack enough support: The claim lacks credible evidence or sources to support the story of a man shooting at Hurricane Florence and dying as a result.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the shooting at Hurricane Florence event on Facebook directly led to the death of a man, without sufficient evidence or confirmation from authorities.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no police departments in Florence or Myrtle Beach were aware of such an incident happening.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the story by presenting it as a tragedy when there is no evidence to support it.
Understate: There is no evidence of any alternative explanation or possibility presented in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters in terms of credibility, as it was flagged as false news by Facebook and no credible news outlets have picked up the story.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide any alternative explanation for the reported incident.
